New Records: Shohei Ohtani became the first player in MLB history with 50 home runs and 50 stolen bases in a single season.
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani went 6-6, hit three home runs, and stole two bases in the game.
Ohtani's 50th home run and 50th stolen base were achieved during this game.
The Los Angeles Dodgers defeated the Miami Marlins 20-4.
The Dodgers clinched a postseason berth with this victory.
Post-Match Reflections: MLB commissioner Rob Manfred congratulated Shohei Ohtani on his remarkable achievement, highlighting his power-and-speed talent, character, drive, and commitment to excellence.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Shohei Ohtani added 0.7 to his WAR just from this game.
Ohtani posted 17 total bases and 10 RBI in the game.
